channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024010361
item.description:
Report X-2024010361

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found box in hazmat cage doing daily cage inspection. DescribePack: cap came loose wich caused liquid to leak DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: box was placed in red hazmat tub with plastic bag to catch liquid

item.title: Report X-2024010156

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUPERVISOR AT IR-4 BULK CALLED FOR RESPONDER DUE TO LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON ARRIVAL THERE WAS A LEAKING BOX ON TOP OF SEVERAL OTHER BOXES. RESPONDER PROCESSED LEAKING HAZMAT THROUGH DMP.

item.title: Report E-2024010003
item.description:
Report E-2024010003

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: Connersville
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading drums noticed a puddle under the drum. It was found that the drum body had a hole in it and material leaked out. Drum was placed in overpack, and material cleaned up in house. The hole was caused by a bolt from another drum.

item.title: Report X-2023121000
item.description:
Report X-2023121000

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A plastic drum was discovered with signs of a release during sort operations at the INDH facility. The drum had a small puncture on the bottom causing the release. The drum was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
